benchmark_config.jira_title: Implement/Test API: POST /1.0/kb/invoiceItems/{invoiceItemId}/tags - Add tags to invoice item

covered: Valid Payload: Multiple scenarios (TC01, TC02, TC03, TC04, TC05, TC13, TC20, TC22) cover successful creation of tags with valid payloads.
Invalid Payload: Scenarios (TC06, TC07, TC09, TC10, TC11, TC12, TC24) test missing required headers, invalid invoice item IDs, malformed JSON, empty or invalid tag lists, and unsupported parameters.
Duplicate Submission: TC13 and TC20 cover duplicate tag definition UUIDs and ensure no duplication in response.
Large Payloads: TC19 tests very large request bodies and proper handling of payload size.
Validation: Multiple tests validate input formats and required fields (e.g., UUID format, non-empty arrays).
Server Error Handling: TC17 and TC21 simulate service unavailability and dependency failures with appropriate error codes.
Authorization: TC16 tests unauthorized access with missing or invalid authentication tokens.
Non-Existent Resource: TC08 and TC15 test behavior when invoice item does not exist.
Edge Cases: TC23 tests maximum allowed tags on an invoice item, TC14 tests performance under heavy load, TC25 tests timeout conditions.
Security: TC18 tests handling of malicious payloads (e.g., SQL injection).
gaps: Rate Limiting: No scenarios test how the system handles multiple rapid requests or throttling.
Concurrency Issues: No tests cover race conditions or concurrent modifications to the same invoice item tags.
Soft Deletes: No tests verify behavior if invoice items or tags are soft deleted.
Partial Update: Not applicable for POST but no tests verify idempotency or repeated requests beyond duplicates.
Caching Behavior: No tests check for caching headers or behavior in responses.
recommendations: Add tests to verify rate limiting and throttling behavior under multiple rapid requests.
Include concurrency tests to simulate race conditions when multiple clients add tags simultaneously.
Add tests to verify behavior when invoice items or tags are soft deleted or archived.
Consider tests for idempotency or repeated identical POST requests beyond duplicate tag UUIDs.
Add scenarios to verify caching headers (e.g., ETag, Cache-Control) in responses if applicable.
